intro: Spermolepis hawaiiensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian spermolepis, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is typically found in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
